page.title: 04COMMERCE IN OAKENGATES
page.content: William Lees Iron Founders. ___________________________ Since 1860 the works has made iron castings from sand moulds. Today they make parts for tractors, trains and cars such as the Mini. Works Manager, Mr. Parkinson, has a staff of 126. 78 are shopfloor workers and 48 are office workers. Despite the depression in the iron and steel trade Wm. Lees claim to be "Founders with a Future". Woolworth's Chain Store. ________________________ Oakengates Woolworth's was 876th to be built. Mr. Hodson has been Manager for 7 years. There are 17 sales staff, 7 of whom are part-timers. 2 people work in the office and 1 person works in the stock-room where goods are kept in sections. These come from Woolworth warehouses and direct from firms.
